description: There are so many ways and places to dance — in the club, in your kitchen, on the streets and, as NPR Music's Lars Gotrich argues, in the mosh pit — so let's showcase its multitudes.
title: 8 Tracks: There's something for everyone in this summer's dance music

description: Ahead of the Fourth of July, let's discuss the nation's founding document: The Declaration of Independence? What's your favorite line, phrase or word from the document?
title: Tell us your favorite line from the Declaration of Independence

description: The taunts and monkey gestures sparked widespread outrage — and led the soccer star and others to say the problems were far bigger than a handful of fans.
title: Racist taunts against soccer star Vinícius Júnior land men 8 months in Spanish prison

description: Gardens are blooming across the country, and while you’ll likely see plenty of roses and brightly-colored zinnias on porches and patios this summer, one much-hyped trend is very, very dark.
title: Darkly romantic goth gardens are having a moment in the sun — here's how to grow one

description: A poll from the advocacy group Voto Latino shows a growing share of voters choosing third-party candidates over either President Biden or former President Trump.
title: Advocacy group finds one-fifth of Latino voters leaning towards third-party presidential candidates

description: June 16 is Father's Day. We want to hear about the dads who shaped your lives.
title: For Father's Day, NPR wants to know about the dads who shaped you

description: Jill Ciment wrote about a relationship she had with a teacher when she was very young – that turned into a marriage – in Half a Life. Now, eight years after his death at 93, she reconsiders their relationship in light of the #MToo movement.
title: In 'Consent,' an author asks: 'Me too? Did I have the agency to consent?'

description: Comedies, action-adventures, coming-of-age tales, animation — plus that sweet, sweet movie theater air conditioning. There's something for everyone at the multiplex; our critics can help you choose.
title: These are the 19 movies we're most excited about this summer

description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with lead actor Joel Basman and director David Schalko about his German-Austrian miniseries Kafka on early 20th century author Franz Kafka, released in the U.S. from June 6.
title: Franz Kafka's life wasn't so kafkaesque after all, TV miniseries shows

description: The Indigenous activist has been in prison nearly 50 years for the 1975 killing of two FBI agents. In ailing health, supporters say this might be his last bid for freedom.
title: Indigenous activist Leonard Peltier has first parole hearing in a decade
